enemies

Class BasicEnemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameMembers.Drawable
      • gameMembers.EnvironmentMember
        • enemies.BasicEnemy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JumpyGuy, ShootyGuy, Slime

    public abstract class BasicEnemy
extends EnvironmentMember

    BasicEnemy

    This class represents any enemy in the game. They all possess health bars and a few basic things that define them as enemies.
    You should extend this class if you have any intent to create a new enemy, even a boss (TODO: Create a boss class??)

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicEnemy

        public BasicEnemy(float x,
                  float y,
                  java.lang.String imagePath,
                  float scale,
                  float health)
        sets all of the default settings for the basicEnemy.
        Parameters:
        x - the initial x location for the character
        y - the initial y location for the character
        imagePath - the sprite path of the character (animations?)
        scale - the scale of the character
        health - the health of the character

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public abstract void update(Point p)
        update

        This method should be implemented in the subclass so that all Enemies can have their locations updated. For now, the only thing they need is the location of the player character (obstacles?)

        Parameters:
        p - the Point location of the player character

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        Description copied from class: EnvironmentMember
        This method is inherited from the Drawable class. This implementation takes a Graphics object when called and uses it to draw the object on the screen. The intended use of this method is to be able to draw an entire ArrayList or Drawable[] and draw the entire thing using a simple loop:

        for(Drawable d : drawables)
        d.draw
        Overrides:
        draw in class EnvironmentMember
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object required to draw

      • follow

        public void follow(Point location,
                   float vel)
        This method provides a convenient way to follow a Point. It uses the pythagorean theorem to determine a proper x and y velocity to follow the Point. Many classes use this method so it's easier to write it once and then never have to use it again.
        Parameters:
        location - the Point location to be followed
        vel - the speed of the character calling this method

        public HealthBar getHealthBar()
